- Topic: Title IX 50th Anniversary Presentation
- Summary: Celebrating the 50th Anniversary of the passage of Title IX, which protects people from discrimination based on sex in education programs or activities that receive federal financial assistance. The presentation was made by Dr. Kiki Baker-Barnes, Commissioner of the Gulf Coast Athletic Conference.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Presentation to honor the 50th Anniversary of Title IX

- Topic: Up Stairs Lounge Arson Attack Tragedy Presentation
- Summary: The City Council posthumously recognized and honored the 32 victims who lost their lives in the Up Stairs Lounge attack on June 24, 1973. The presentation was made by Robert W. Fieseler, author of "Tinderbox: The Untold Story of the Up Stairs Lounge Fire and the Rise of Gay Liberation," and others.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Suspend the Rules to go to Resolution R-22-308 - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The City Council decided to suspend the rules to go to Resolution R-22-308 in recognition of the Up Stairs Lounge tragedy.
- Tags/Keywords: Up Stairs Lounge, arson attack, tragedy, recognition
- UID: 5d580ac2-9320-4a2e-833c-242fba6bfc52

- Topic: Formal Apology for Up Stairs Lounge Fire Victims
- Summary: Resolution stating the City Council deems it necessary to formally apologize to the victims, survivors, and families affected by the 1973 Up Stairs Lounge fire for the inadequate public mourning of those who perished.
- Ordinance Number: R-22-308
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The City Council passed the resolution to formally apologize to the victims of the 1973 Up Stairs Lounge fire.
- Tags/Keywords: Formal Apology, Up Stairs Lounge Fire, Resolution, City Council
- UID: f41448e5-1e73-4e71-988c-1622c0d7c967
